title: 109_hr5933
content: The "Business Travel Facilitation Act of 2006" may be cited as the Business Travel Facilitation Act. This Act pertains to business facilitation visitors. The Business Travel Facilitation Act of 2006, also known as the Business Travel Facilitation Act, amends the Immigration and Nationality Act to include business facilitation visitors. These visitors are aliens temporarily visiting the US to provide services under a qualifying services contract or to give/receive management or technical training. The Business Travel Facilitation Act of 2006 allows business facilitation visitors to provide services under a qualifying services contract or receive management or technical training from a US entity. Aliens must be nationals of countries certified by the Secretary of Homeland Security to combat visa fraud to be admitted as business facilitation visitors. The Business Travel Facilitation Act of 2006 allows business facilitation visitors from countries certified to combat visa fraud to provide services or receive training from a US entity. Conditions include using machine-readable passports and biometric technology for visa applications. The Business Travel Facilitation Act of 2006 allows business facilitation visitors to provide services or receive training from a US entity under certain conditions, including the employer covering all remuneration and expenses and the alien being qualified with expert knowledge. The Business Travel Facilitation Act of 2006 allows business facilitation visitors to provide services or receive training from a US entity under certain conditions, including possessing expert knowledge and all required licenses. The Business Travel Facilitation Act of 2006 allows business facilitation visitors to receive technical training under specific conditions, such as being affiliated with a US entity through ownership, joint venture agreements, or potential business transactions. The Business Travel Facilitation Act of 2006 allows business facilitation visitors to receive technical training related to purchasing or selling goods/services from a US entity, with all expenses covered by the employer. Management training requires at least 5 years of relevant experience. The Business Travel Facilitation Act of 2006 allows business facilitation visitors to receive management training if they have at least 5 years of relevant experience and detailed knowledge of their employer's business operations. Additionally, the alien seeking training must hold a management level position within their employer within 1 year of completing the training. The Business Travel Facilitation Act of 2006 allows business facilitation visitors to receive management training if they meet specific criteria. The period of authorized admission for an alien admitted as a business facilitation visitor providing professional services shall not exceed 1 year, with a possible 6-month extension under certain circumstances. The period of authorized admission for an alien admitted as a business facilitation visitor providing or receiving management or technical training may not exceed 1 year, with no change of status allowed. The Secretary of Homeland Security may prohibit nationals from admission as business facilitation visitors if they engage in fraud. The Secretary of Homeland Security can ban nationals from entering the US as business facilitation visitors for a specified period if they are involved in fraudulent activities. A qualifying services contract is defined as a contract between a foreign professional services provider and a US entity, outlining the time period, duties, remuneration, and expenses of the alien in the US. The qualifying services contract specifies the duties, remuneration, and credentials of the alien in the US, ensuring comparable working conditions to other professional service providers. The qualifying services contract under the Fair Labor Standards Act requires the alien to possess necessary credentials and responsibilities for compliance with admission terms and return to their home country.
